instruction: Complete the sentences. Choose an adjective. (All answers use '… of'.)

items.prompt: I’m ____ of heights, so I avoid tall bridges.
She was ____ of the mess and cleaned it up quickly.
Are you ____ of the time? We need to leave now.
He isn’t ____ of fixing it himself. He needs help.
I’m not ____ of the exact date, but it’s next week.
I’ve always been ____ of old jazz records.
This folder is ____ of photos from the trip.
Her parents are ____ of her exam results.

instruction: Choose the best phrase to complete each sentence.

items.prompt: I’m ____ remembering names.
He’s ____ explaining things clearly.
She’s ____ drawing, but she enjoys it.
I’m ____ waking up early.
They’re ____ dancing, so they avoid discos.

instruction: Put in the correct preposition after the adjective.

items.prompt: She’s responsible ____ organising the schedule.
This town is famous ____ its beaches.
I was surprised ____ his decision.
Are you interested ____ learning Italian?
It was kind ____ you to call.
I’m tired ____ listening to complaints.
This photo is similar ____ the one you showed me.
I’m nervous ____ the interview tomorrow.

instruction: Complete the second sentence so it means the same as the first.

items.prompt: I know this app well. -> I’m familiar ____ this app.
She can’t cook. -> She’s hopeless ____ cooking.
They feel proud because of their son's success. -> They’re proud ____ their son’s success.
My plan isn’t the same as yours. -> My plan is different ____ yours.
This jacket looks like mine. -> This jacket is similar ____ mine.
I have to handle the budget. -> I’m responsible ____ the budget.
He doesn’t want to hear any more criticism. -> He’s tired ____ criticism.
We’re looking forward to the trip. -> We’re excited ____ the trip.
I’m angry ____ myself for forgetting.
She was annoyed ____ the noise next door.
He’s good ____ maths.
I’m grateful ____ your help.
Are you worried ____ the exam?
I was impressed ____ her pronunciation.
This room is crowded ____ tourists in summer.
I’m not used ____ driving on the left.
She was shocked ____ the news.
He was married ____ a doctor for years.

instruction: Which sentence is correct? Choose a or b.

items.prompt:
a) I explained the problem to her.

b) I explained the problem at her.

a) Can you listen to me for a minute?

b) Can you listen me for a minute?

a) He thanked to me for the advice.

b) He thanked me for the advice.

a) She pointed at the menu.

b) She pointed to the menu.

a) I spoke her yesterday.

b) I spoke to her yesterday.

a) Don’t shout to the waiter.

b) Don’t shout at the waiter.

a) I wrote to my parents last night.

b) I wrote my parents last night.

a) He threw the ball to me.

b) He threw the ball at me.

a) Someone threw a stone to the window.

b) Someone threw a stone at the window.

a) She smiled at the baby.

b) She smiled to the baby.

a) I answered to the phone immediately.

b) I answered the phone immediately.

a) They replied to my email.

b) They replied my email.

instruction: Complete each gap with a suitable verb + preposition.

items.prompt: I can’t ____ ____ what he’s saying. (follow his words)
Please ____ ____ the photo on the wall. (use your finger)
She ____ ____ me very politely. (answered my question)
Can you ____ ____ this diagram? (make it clear)
Don’t ____ ____ your little sister. (be angry and loud)
He ____ ____ me and said ‘hello’. (directed his eyes)
I can’t ____ ____ that joke. (it’s not funny)
She ____ ____ the teacher after class. (said something)
He ____ the keys ____ me. (so I could catch them)
I shouted ____ him, but he didn’t hear me.
Stop shouting ____ me!
She threw the remote ____ her brother.
He threw the ball ____ his brother.
I waved ____ the bus driver.
Don’t point ____ people. It’s rude.
She smiled ____ me and walked past.
He was talking ____ his friends.
She was listening ____ music.
They were laughing ____ my accent.
I’m writing ____ you to say thanks.

instruction: Which sentence is correct? Choose a or b.

items.prompt:
a) We discussed the problem.

b) We discussed about the problem.

a) I applied for the job online.

b) I applied the job online.

a) We talked about our plans.

b) We talked our plans.

a) I’m waiting for the bus.

b) I’m waiting the bus.

a) She asked me for directions.

b) She asked me directions.

a) We must do something about the traffic.

b) We must do something for the traffic.

a) He’s searching for his passport.

b) He’s searching his passport.

a) I don’t know much about that topic.

b) I don’t know much of that topic.

instruction: Put in about / for, or leave the gap empty.

items.prompt: We discussed ____ the schedule for next week.
I read ____ the museum in a travel guide.
They asked ____ a refund.
We’re still waiting ____ a reply.
Do you know anything ____ this restaurant?
She searched ____ her keys for ten minutes.
We talked ____ the new teacher.
He applied ____ a place at the university.

instruction: Complete the sentences with care about / care for / take care of / look after.

items.prompt: I don’t really ____ ____ football. (it isn’t important to me)

instruction: Which sentence is correct? Choose a or b.

items.prompt:
a) What happened to your arm?

b) What happened with your arm?

a) They invited me to the party.

b) They invited me on the party.

a) I prefer tea to coffee.

b) I prefer tea than coffee.

b) Please concentrate at the question.

b) He insisted to pay.

instruction: Complete each sentence. Choose a particle.
